data.title: Artesian Resources 3Q EPS 68c >ARTNA
Acuity SVP & General Counsel Barry R Goldman Sells 4,489 Shares
data.description:
Reporter NameGoldman Barry R
RelationshipSVP & General Counsel, 10% Owner
TypeSell
Amount$1,638,989
SEC FilingForm 4

Barry R Goldman, SVP & General Counsel and 10% owner at Acuity, sold 4,489 shares of Common Stock on October 28, 2025. The transactions were made at weighted average prices ranging from $362.18 to $370.46. The total sale amount was $1,638,989. Following these transactions, Goldman directly owns 6,056 shares of Acuity.

SEC Filing: ACUITY INC. (DE) [ AYI ] - Form 4 - Oct. 30, 2025

data.title: US stocks spooked by AI spending concerns, Powell's hawkish tone
data.description:
Key points:
  • Main US indexes end red; Nasdaq falls ~1.6%
  • Cons Disc weakest S&P 500 sector; Real Estate leads gainers
  • Dollar gains; gold up ~2.5%; crude slips; bitcoin loses ~4.5%
  • US 10-Year Treasury yield rises to ~4.09%

US STOCKS SPOOKED BY AI SPENDING CONCERNS, POWELL'S HAWKISH TONE

U.S. stocks dropped on Thursday amid worries over surging AI spending, while investors also digested a more hawkish tone from the U.S. Federal Reserve.

Meanwhile, a widely anticipated trade agreement between U.S. President Donald Trump and Chinese President Xi Jinping appeared to do little to boost stocks on the day.

The Dow Jones Composite (.DJA) and the S&P 500 Industrial sector both hit record intraday highs, but couldn't hold their gains. Both ended down on the day.

Meta Platforms shares plunged more than 11% after the social media company forecast "notably larger" capital expenses next year, thanks to investments in artificial intelligence.

Microsoft dipped about 3% after the tech giant reported a record capital expenditure of nearly $35 billion for its fiscal first quarter and warned that spending would rise this year.

That said, Alphabet rose 2.5% on Thursday as steady growth in the advertising business and cloud computing powered better-than-expected results.

Overall, the Magnificent Seven ETF was an underperformer on the day, sliding 3.1%. Investors are focusing on quarterly numbers from two more members of the group as Apple and Amazon.com are reporting after the close.

The results followed the Federal Reserve's delivery on Wednesday of a widely expected quarter-point rate cut, before Chair Jerome Powell then raised doubts about future policy moves when in his press conference he said that a December cut was not a "foregone conclusion."

The CME FedWatch Tool now puts the odds of a December rate cut at about 73% vs just over 90% one week ago.

In any event, despite the market's post-FOMC letdown, Craig Cohen, Managing Director, Global Investment Opportunities Group at J.P. Morgan pointed out Wednesday in a Market Intelligence Briefing that yesterday's rate cut was the fifth time that the Fed reduced its target rate with the S&P 500 index at all-time highs.

He notes that in all prior instances, the S&P 500 was higher a year later with an average return of 20%. The worst one-year return was a 15% advance which occurred last year.

Here is a snapshot of where markets stood just shortly after 4 p.m. ET:

(Terence Gabriel)

*****

EARLIER ON LIVE MARKETS:

data.title: Amazon beats Q3 net sales, EPS estimates
data.description:
Overview

  • Amazon Q3 2025 net sales grow 13% yr/yr, beating analysts' expectations, driven by AWS and international segments

  • Adjusted EPS for Q3 beats consensus, reflecting strong operational performance

  • Company's operating income impacted by special charges, net income rises significantly

Outlook

  • Amazon expects Q4 2025 net sales between $206.0 bln and $213.0 bln

  • Company anticipates Q4 2025 operating income between $21.0 bln and $26.0 bln

  • Amazon's guidance includes a favorable FX impact of 190 basis points

Result Drivers

  • AWS GROWTH - AWS sales increased 20% yr/yr, driven by strong demand for AI and core infrastructure, according to CEO Andy Jassy

  • INTERNATIONAL SALES - International segment sales rose 14% yr/yr, aided by favorable foreign exchange rates

  • SPECIAL CHARGES - Operating income impacted by $2.5 bln legal settlement and $1.8 bln severance costs

Key Details

Beat/Miss

Actual

Consensus Estimate

Analyst Coverage

  • The current average analyst rating on the shares is "buy" and the breakdown of recommendations is 71 "strong buy" or "buy", 1 "hold" and no "sell" or "strong sell"

  • The average consensus recommendation for the department stores peer group is "buy"

  • Wall Street's median 12-month price target for Amazon.com Inc is $265.00, about 13.1% above its October 29 closing price of $230.30

  • Launched new payment features to enhance customer engagement and efficiency

Outlook

  • Weave expects Q4 revenue between $62.4 mln and $63.4 mln

  • Company forecasts full-year revenue of $238 mln to $239 mln

  • Weave projects Q4 non-GAAP income from operations of $1.5 mln to $2.5 mln

  • Company anticipates full-year non-GAAP income from operations of $3.3 mln to $4.3 mln

Result Drivers

  • PAYMENT FEATURES - Launched new surcharging and bulk payment features to address customer needs and improve efficiency

  • PRODUCT ADVANCEMENTS - Significant advancements across product roadmap contributed to revenue growth, per CEO Brett White

data.title: Dexcom Q3 revenue up 22%, beats estimates, lifts 2025 revenue forecast
data.description:
Overview

  • Dexcom Q3 2025 revenue grows 22% yr/yr, beating analyst expectations

  • Adjusted EPS for Q3 2025 beats analyst expectations, reflecting positive operational performance

  • Company raises fiscal year 2025 revenue guidance, indicating confidence in continued growth

Outlook

  • Dexcom raises 2025 revenue guidance to $4.630-$4.650 bln, reflecting 15% growth

  • Company expects 2025 non-GAAP gross profit margin of approximately 61%

  • Dexcom anticipates 2025 adjusted EBITDA margin of 29-30%

Result Drivers

  • AI-POWERED FEATURE - Launched AI-powered meal logging in Stelo and Dexcom G7 app, enhancing personalized glucose insights

  • EXPANDED ACCESS - Expanded access to Dexcom G7 for insulin users under Ontario Drug Benefit Program in Canada

  • STRATEGIC INITIATIVES - Submitted Dexcom Smart Basal insulin titration module to FDA, aiming to enhance product offerings

data.title: Gilead Sciences Q3 adjusted EPS beats estimates helped by higher demand for HIV products
data.description:
Overview

  • Gilead Q3 2025 total revenue rises 3% yr/yr to $7.8 bln

  • Adjusted EPS for Q3 2025 beats analyst expectations, per LSEG data

  • Product sales excluding Veklury increase 4% to $7.1 bln

Outlook

  • Gilead raises full-year product sales guidance to $28.4 bln-$28.7 bln

  • Company increases full-year diluted EPS guidance to $6.65-$6.85

  • Gilead anticipates multiple product launches in 2026

Result Drivers

  • HIV SALES - HIV product sales increased 4% to $5.3 bln, driven by higher demand and favorable inventory dynamics, though offset by lower average realized price

  • LIVER DISEASE SALES - Liver Disease portfolio sales rose 12% to $819 mln, mainly due to higher demand for Livdelzi

  • VEKLURY DECLINE - Veklury sales dropped 60% to $277 mln, attributed to lower COVID-19-related hospitalizations

data.title: Key facts: Carlyle Group to report earnings; expects 10.3% revenue growth
data.description:
• Carlyle Group (CG) will report earnings this Friday, with analysts expecting 10.3% revenue growth to about $987.3 million and adjusted earnings of $1.02 per share.1
  • Carlyle Group joined the Abu Dhabi Global Market (ADGM) community in 2025, enhancing ADGM's status as a prominent financial center for global investment firms.2

data.title: Key facts: CVS Health Q3 sales rise 7.8%; price targets increased; $5.7B write-down
data.description:
• CVS Health's Q3 2025 earnings showed sales of $102.9 billion, up 7.8% year-on-year, with adjusted EPS of $1.61, surpassing estimates by 18.3%. Full-year EPS guidance raised to $6.60.1
  • Several financial firms have boosted their price targets for CVS Health, with Evercore ISI raising it to $95, RBC Capital to $93, and Cantor Fitzgerald to $95.2
  • CVS Health announced a $5.7 billion write-down linked to its Oak Street Health acquisition, underscoring ongoing profitability issues since Oak Street's 2020 IPO.3

data.title: Key facts: Bristol Myers Squibb Q3 Sales Up 7% to $2.53 Billion; Stock Rises 5.39%
data.description:
• Bristol Myers Squibb reported a 7% increase in sales of its cancer drug Opdivo, reaching $2.53 billion, bolstered by a new injectable version that added $67 million, exceeding analysts' expectations.1
  • On October 30, 2025, Bristol Myers Squibb reported its Q3 financial results and will hold a conference call for analysts and investors at 8:00 a.m. ET.2
  • Bristol-Myers Squibb Company (BMY) is trading at $44.90, having increased by $2.30 or 5.39%, marking the company's largest percent increase since November 11, 2024.3

data.title: Key facts: BorgWarner Q3 Earnings Rise; Warns of Production Halts
data.description:
• BorgWarner Inc. reported Q3 2025 adjusted earnings of $1.24 per share, up from $1.09 last year. Net sales reached $3.59 billion, a 4.1% year-over-year increase.12
  • BorgWarner Inc. warns of possible production halts due to supply issues with Nexperia and a fire at Novelis, expecting a $50 million to $100 million impact in Q4.3
